column4: i am now root but. when i drag my mouse to actually close the text editor and save the xorg.conf i edited it wont let me still because of permissions
don
don't repeat pls
sudo su is not recommended. Open the file with sudo nano filename or similar
use sudo -i if you need a root shell
it says on the bottom of the screen. Ctrl-O to write out, Ctrl-X to exit.
thanks it worked

http://thinkwiki.org/wiki/Installation_instructions_for_the_ThinkPad_T60p I am on the second part starting there "[On my UXGA t60p the ChipID line" can you elaborate on that? I am not sure what they are telling me to do
will have a look later. Putting daughter to bed now.
do you actually have that particular laptop model?
yes i do
i edited the xorg.conf already i'm on the second part now
what's the second part? Where it says "Kubuntu..."?
go a little up its in installing ubuntu dapper

[On my UXGA t60p the ChipID line was actually fatal to getting fglrx to start up (/var/log/Xorg.0.log showed the driver falling back to VESA and fgl_glxgears would crash). Without that ChipID line my chip was identified as
that line
what it says is that you may or may not need the ChipID line in xorg.conf. Is it in your current one?
let me check
it says ChipID 0x71c5

okay. Now you should be able to reboot and get a graphical login. *If* you don't, you'll have to login on a text console, run 'sudo nano /etc/X11/xorg.conf' and add a # so it says #ChipID, and then run 'sudo /etc/init.d/gdm restart'.
I got the graphical login. The reason I tried to follow that guide is because of laggyness on splash screens. I thought it would help it but it still happens. =/
